CENPA: Centromere-specific histone H3 variant; essential for kinetochore assembly and chromosome segregation.
CENPB: Centromere-binding protein B; binds specific centromeric DNA sequences (CENP-B box) to organize heterochromatin.
H1: Linker histone family; binds nucleosome entry/exit sites to promote chromatin condensation and higher-order structure.
H1.0: Differentiation-specific linker histone variant; accumulates in terminally differentiated cells to condense chromatin.
H1.2: Somatic linker histone; involved in chromatin compaction and apoptosis (translocates to mitochondria upon DNA damage).
H1.4: Somatic linker histone; regulates gene expression and chromatin folding; specific modifications link to cell cycle control.
H1.4K34ac: Acetylation of H1.4; associated with transcriptional activation and recruitment of TAF1.
H1.4S187ph: Phosphorylation of H1.4; occurs during mitosis and is associated with transcription.
H1.5: Somatic linker histone; associated with chromatin compaction and gene repression.
H1.X: Linker histone variant; associated with nucleoli and RNA polymerase I transcription.
H1B: Linker histone variant (often synonymous with H1.5 in human nomenclature or specific mouse variants); chromatin compaction.
H1K27me2: Methylation of linker histone; typically associated with heterochromatin and transcriptional repression.
H1K85ac: Acetylation of linker histone; associated with chromatin relaxation and DNA damage response.
H1fnt: Testis-specific linker histone; essential for spermiogenesis and chromatin reorganization in sperm.
H1t: Testis-specific linker histone; facilitates chromatin remodeling during meiosis.
H2: Refers generally to the H2A and H2B core histone families.
H2A: Core histone protein; forms a dimer with H2B; central to nucleosome stability.
H2A.B: Histone H2A variant (formerly H2A.Bbd); 'Barr body deficient'; associated with active chromatin and mRNA processing.
H2A.Bbd1: Specific isoform of H2A.B; associated with open chromatin and transcriptionally active regions.
H2A.V: Drosophila H2A variant; combines functions of mammalian H2A.Z and H2A.X (transcriptional regulation and DNA damage response).
H2A.VS137ph: Phosphorylation of H2A.V (Drosophila); marks DNA damage sites (analogous to H2A.X S139ph).
H2A.X: Core histone H2A variant; critical for DNA double-strand break repair and signaling.
H2A.XS139ph: Phosphorylation of H2A.X (Gamma-H2AX); the hallmark marker for DNA double-strand breaks.
H2A.Z: Core histone H2A variant; located at promoters and enhancers; regulates gene responsiveness and stability.
H2A.Z.1: Major isoform of H2A.Z; essential for development and gene regulation.
H2A.Z.2: Isoform of H2A.Z; distinct genomic localization; linked to specific neurological functions.
H2A.ZK4K7K11ac: Hyperacetylation of H2A.Z N-terminal tail; correlates strongly with active transcription and open chromatin.
H2A.ZK4K7ac: Acetylation of H2A.Z; associated with active promoters.
H2A.Zac: General acetylation of H2A.Z; marks active gene promoters and enhancers.
H2AK118ub: Ubiquitination of H2A (residue numbering can vary by organism); generally repressive.
H2AK119ub: Monoubiquitination of H2A by PRC1; a critical mark for Polycomb-mediated gene silencing.
H2AK120Ub: Ubiquitination of H2A (often synonymous with K119 depending on counting); repressive mark.
H2AK130ac: Acetylation of H2A; associated with transcriptional activation.
H2AK5ac: Acetylation of H2A; associated with transcriptional activation and DNA replication.
H2AK9ac: Acetylation of H2A; associated with active promoters.
H2AS129ph: Phosphorylation of H2A (yeast equivalent of H2A.X S139ph); DNA damage response.
H2AS40GlcNAc: O-GlcNAcylation of H2A; regulates nucleosome stability and DNA damage response.
H2AT120ph: Phosphorylation of H2A; essential for mitosis and chromosome segregation.
H2Aub: General reference to ubiquitinated H2A; usually repressive (if K119) or signaling-related.
H2B: Core histone protein; forms a dimer with H2A; involved in transcriptional regulation.
H2BK119ub: Ubiquitination of H2B (yeast equivalent of human K120); associated with transcriptional elongation.
H2BK11ac: Acetylation of H2B; associated with active transcription.
H2BK120ac: Acetylation of H2B; marks active promoters and enhancers.
H2BK120ub: Monoubiquitination of H2B (human); associated with active transcription elongation and stem cell differentiation.
H2BK123ub: Ubiquitination of H2B (yeast numbering); stimulates H3K4 and H3K79 methylation; transcriptional activation.
H2BK12ac: Acetylation of H2B; associated with active transcription.
H2BK15ac: Acetylation of H2B; associated with active transcription and DNA repair.
H2BK16ac: Acetylation of H2B; marks active genes.
H2BK20ac: Acetylation of H2B; associated with active enhancers and promoters.
H2BK5ac: Acetylation of H2B; associated with active promoters.
H2BK5bhb: Beta-hydroxybutyrylation of H2B; links metabolism (ketogenesis) to gene activation.
H2BP1me1: Proline methylation of H2B (rare); function not fully characterized.
H2BS112GlcNAc: O-GlcNAcylation of H2B; facilitates H2B ubiquitination and active transcription.
H2Bac: Pan-acetylation of H2B; general marker of open chromatin.
H2Bub: General reference to ubiquitinated H2B; usually associated with active transcription.
H3: Core histone protein; N-terminal tail is the primary site of post-translational modifications (the histone code).
H3.1: Canonical replication-dependent H3 variant; incorporated during S-phase; associated with gene silencing.
H3.2: Canonical replication-dependent H3 variant; similar to H3.1 but chemically distinct; enriched in repressive chromatin.
H3.3: Replication-independent H3 variant; accumulates at active genes, telomeres, and regulatory elements throughout the cell cycle.
H3.3 K27M mutant: Oncohistone mutation (Lysine 27 to Methionine) in H3.3; inhibits PRC2 and causes global loss of H3K27me3; drives pediatric gliomas.
H3.3B: Gene coding for the H3.3 variant.
H3.3K27me3: Trimethylation of H3.3 at Lys27; involved in silencing at specific genomic loci.
H3.3S31ph: Phosphorylation of H3.3; specific to mitosis in amplified regions; potential marker for lagging chromosomes.
H3.5: H3 variant; human testis-specific; associated with active chromatin in spermatogenesis.
H3.6: H3 variant (often refers to specific plant or lineage-specific variants); function context-dependent.
H3.7: Putative primate-specific H3 variant; function largely unknown.
H3.Y: Primate-specific H3 variant; similar to H3.3; involved in regulation of gene expression and stress response.
H3K122ac: Acetylation of H3 globular domain; disrupts nucleosome stability to facilitate transcription.
H3K122sc: Succiniylation of H3 globular domain; associated with gene activation and DNA damage response.
H3K12ac: Acetylation of H3; marks active promoters and islands.
H3K14ac: Acetylation of H3; associated with transcriptional activation and elongation.
H3K14bu: Butyrylation of H3; associated with active gene expression (metabolic link).
H3K14cr: Crotonylation of H3; marks active promoters/enhancers; resists repression.
H3K14me3: Trimethylation of H3; associated with active transcription (less common than acetylation).
H3K14pr: Propionylation of H3; marks active chromatin.
H3K18ac: Acetylation of H3; regulated by p300/CBP; marks active promoters and enhancers.
H3K18cr: Crotonylation of H3; associated with active transcription.
H3K18la: Lactylation of H3; induced by lactate (Warburg effect); stimulates gene transcription for wound healing/M2 macrophages.
H3K18pr: Propionylation of H3; active chromatin mark.
H3K18ub: Ubiquitination of H3; associated with cell proliferation and activation.
H3K20me1: Monomethylation of H3; associated with transcriptional activation and transition to heterochromatin.
H3K20me3: Trimethylation of H3; distinct marker of constitutive heterochromatin and repetitive elements.
H3K23ac: Acetylation of H3; associated with active transcription.
H3K23me1: Monomethylation of H3; function less defined, found in C. elegans meiosis.
H3K23me2: Dimethylation of H3; involved in heterochromatin maintenance.
H3K23me3: Trimethylation of H3; found in Tetrahymena and C. elegans; repression/heterochromatin.
H3K23su: Succiniylation of H3; metabolic regulation of chromatin.
H3K26me3: Trimethylation of H3 (likely referring to numbering variation or specific organism); typically repressive.
H3K27M: See H3.3 K27M mutant (can occur in H3.1 as well); driver of midline gliomas.
H3K27ac: Acetylation of H3; distinct marker of active enhancers and promoters.
H3K27me1: Monomethylation of H3; associated with active gene bodies and enhancers.
H3K27me2: Dimethylation of H3; prevents enhancer over-activation; broadly distributed in non-active regions.
H3K27me3: Trimethylation of H3; hallmark of facultative heterochromatin; Polycomb-mediated repression.
H3K27me3S28ph: Methyl/Phospho switch; Phosphorylation at S28 ejects Polycomb complexes from K27me3, allowing transient activation.
H3K28ac: Acetylation of H3 (alternative numbering for K27 in some systems, or distinct lysine in variants).
H3K29ac: Acetylation of H3; rare; associated with gene activation.
H3K30ac: Acetylation of H3; rare; function under investigation.
H3K31ac: Acetylation of H3 globular domain; associated with active transcription.
H3K32ac: Acetylation of H3; rare; function under investigation.
H3K34me3: Trimethylation of H3; rare; potential role in specific developmental stages.
H3K36ac: Acetylation of H3; associated with active promoters.
H3K36me1: Monomethylation of H3; intermediate mark; active coding regions.
H3K36me2: Dimethylation of H3; intergenic regions; prevents cryptic initiation.
H3K36me3: Trimethylation of H3; marks gene bodies of actively transcribed genes (elongation).
H3K4ac: Acetylation of H3; marks active promoters.
H3K4bhb: Beta-hydroxybutyrylation of H3; induced by starvation/ketosis; activates specific gene programs.
H3K4me: Methylation of H3K4 (general); associated with active or poised chromatin.
H3K4me1: Monomethylation of H3; hallmark of enhancer elements.
H3K4me2: Dimethylation of H3; marks both promoters and enhancers.
H3K4me3: Trimethylation of H3; hallmark of active transcription start sites (promoters).
H3K4me3Q5ser: Serotonylation of Glutamine 5 adjacent to H3K4me3; stabilizes TFIID binding to support high expression.
H3K4ox: Oxidation of H3K4; generated by LOX enzymes; gene repression.
H3K56ac: Acetylation of H3 globular domain; marks newly synthesized histones; DNA repair and transcription.
H3K5ac: Acetylation of H3; associated with active chromatin.
H3K64ac: Acetylation of H3 globular domain; marks active genes and protects against heterochromatin spreading.
H3K79homocysteine: Homocysteine modification (metabolic byproduct); inhibits H3K79 methylation.
H3K79me1: Monomethylation of H3; active gene bodies.
H3K79me2: Dimethylation of H3; active gene bodies; cell cycle regulation.
H3K79me3: Trimethylation of H3 (Dot1l mediated); active elongation; Wnt signaling pathway.
H3K79suc: Succinylation of H3; associated with active metabolism and transcription.
H3K9K14K18K23K27ac: Hyperacetylation of H3 N-terminal tail; maximum chromatin openness.
H3K9K14ac: Dual acetylation; strong marker of active promoters.
H3K9S10me3: Could refer to K9 methylation with S10 phosphorylation; 'Methyl/Phospho switch' during mitosis.
H3K9ac: Acetylation of H3; marker of active promoters; mutually exclusive with H3K9me.
H3K9acS10ph: Dual modification; Phospho-acetylation; associated with immediate early gene activation (e.g., c-Fos).
H3K9bhb: Beta-hydroxybutyrylation of H3; metabolic regulation of gene expression.
H3K9bu: Butyrylation of H3; marks active promoters; distinct from acetylation.
H3K9cr: Crotonylation of H3; marks active promoters; active in post-meiotic spermatids.
H3K9la: Lactylation of H3; metabolic feedback loop to regulate transcription.
H3K9me1: Monomethylation of H3; associated with active genes but also heterochromatin boundary.
H3K9me2: Dimethylation of H3; large repressive blocks (LADs); facultative heterochromatin.
H3K9me3: Trimethylation of H3; hallmark of constitutive heterochromatin; recruits HP1.
H3Kac: Pan-acetylation of H3; general active chromatin.
H3R26cit: Citrullination of Arginine 26; associated with chromatin decondensation and immune response (NETosis).
H3R2me2: Dimethylation of Arginine 2; repressive (prevents H3K4me3) or active depending on symmetry.
H3R2me2K4me3: Dual mark context; H3R2me2s usually inhibits H3K4me3; presence implies specific regulatory state.
H3R3me2: Dimethylation of Arginine 3 (likely typo for H4R3 or H3R2/8/17/26); if H3R2, see H3R2me2.
H3R8me2s: Symmetric dimethylation of H3R8; transcriptional repression.
H3S10ph: Phosphorylation of Serine 10; distinct roles in mitosis (chromosome condensation) and interphase (gene activation).
H3S10phK14ac: Phospho-acetylation; hallmark of epidermal growth factor/MAPK signaling and immediate early gene induction.
H3S28ph: Phosphorylation of Serine 28; mitotic chromosome condensation; correlates with H3S10ph.
H3S31ph: Phosphorylation of Serine 31 (specifically on H3.3); mitotic mark in lagging chromosomes.
H3S57ph: Phosphorylation of H3; potential role in structural change or signaling.
H3T11ph: Phosphorylation of Threonine 11; associated with transcriptional activation and metabolic stress.
H3T3ph: Phosphorylation of Threonine 3; mitotic mark essential for chromosome alignment (haspin kinase).
H3T45ph: Phosphorylation of Threonine 45; associated with DNA replication and apoptosis.
H3T6ph: Phosphorylation of Threonine 6; prevents H3K4 demethylation; gene activation.
H3Y54ph: Phosphorylation of Tyrosine 54; excludes binding of certain factors; structural regulation.
H3mm11: Mouse-specific H3 variant; function in developmental programming.
H3mm12: Mouse-specific H3 variant; function in developmental programming.
H3mm13: Mouse-specific H3 variant; function in developmental programming.
H3mm16: Mouse-specific H3 variant; function in developmental programming.
H3mm7: Mouse-specific H3 variant; essential for skeletal muscle differentiation.
H4: Core histone protein; highly conserved; crucial for nucleosome structure and interactions with H3.
H4K12ac: Acetylation of H4; imprint of histone deposition; active chromatin.
H4K12me1: Monomethylation of H4; rare; function undefined.
H4K16ac: Acetylation of H4; inhibits formation of 30nm fiber; decompaction; dosage compensation (Drosophila).
H4K20ac: Acetylation of H4; associated with gene repression (prevents K20 methylation).
H4K20me1: Monomethylation of H4; associated with transcriptional activation and mitosis.
H4K20me2: Dimethylation of H4; most abundant H4 mark; DNA replication and repair (53BP1 binding).
H4K20me3: Trimethylation of H4; hallmark of heterochromatin and repetitive regions; repression.
H4K44ac: Acetylation of H4 globular domain; facilitates transcription.
H4K58ac: Acetylation of H4 globular domain; regulates transcriptional response.
H4K5K8K12K16ac: Tetra-acetylation of H4 tail; highly active chromatin; deposition mark.
H4K5ac: Acetylation of H4; deposition mark for new histones; active chromatin.
H4K5bu: Butyrylation of H4; spermatogenesis; activates transcription.
H4K5cr: Crotonylation of H4; marks active genes in post-meiotic germ cells.
H4K8ac: Acetylation of H4; transcriptional activation; recruits SWI/SNF.
H4K8bhb: Beta-hydroxybutyrylation of H4; metabolic gene regulation.
H4K91ac: Acetylation of H4 core; regulates nucleosome assembly/disassembly and stability.
H4R3me2: Dimethylation of Arginine 3; context dependent (see a/s forms).
H4R3me2a: Asymmetric dimethylation of H4R3; transcriptional activation.
H4R3me2s: Symmetric dimethylation of H4R3; transcriptional repression.
H4Y88ph: Phosphorylation of Tyrosine 88; alters nucleosome interaction with other factors; active transcription.
HINFP: Histone H4 transcription factor; regulates H4 gene expression (not a histone itself).
HTZ1: Yeast homolog of H2A.Z; prevents spread of heterochromatin.
Pan lysine acetylation: Antibody/method detecting acetylation on any lysine residue; general open chromatin.
Pan lysine crotonylation: Antibody/method detecting crotonylation on any lysine residue; general active/metabolic chromatin.
TH2A: Testis-specific H2A variant; essential for spermatogenesis.
TH2B: Testis-specific H2B variant; replaces H2B during spermatogenesis; destabilizes nucleosomes.
TH2BS11ph: Phosphorylation of TH2B; associated with meiotic chromosome condensation.
hcp-3: C. elegans homolog of CENP-A; centromere specification.
hcp-4: C. elegans homolog of CENP-C; kinetochore assembly.
htz-1: C. elegans homolog of H2A.Z; transcriptional regulation.
macroH2A: Large H2A variant with a macro domain; generally repressive; enriched on the inactive X chromosome.
macroH2A1: Isoform of macroH2A; involved in repression and metabolism.
macroH2A1.2: Splice variant of macroH2A1; binds PARP metabolites; involved in DNA repair.
macroH2A2: Isoform of macroH2A; generally repressive; suppresses metastasis in cancer.
